answers.answer: hang in there mama! I had a good experience with being induced. It's still possible to be induced and deliver vaginally. I was induced at 40+6 and had a 13 hr labor and brought my baby girl into the world vaginally

I was induced. It was rough being strapped to a bed for so long. I started dialating after 13 hours. After that it went rather quickly. I went 1-6cm dialated in a few hours then to 9cm in 15 min! I was never given pitocin though,  just the cervadil did the trick. You got this! 2 weeks is a whole lot of time!
If you aren't even 38 weeks yet I wouldn't worry about not being dilated. It means nothing. You can go from O-10 within a matter of hours

I personally waited it out. I delivered my first and 40 weeks 6 days. Yes I was miserable but I knew she wasn't ready and neither was my body. If you have an option I would wait til at least 40 weeks and then think about inducing.
I have diabetes so that's why I'm being induced on my due date.
I got gestational diabetis and i got my appointment to be induced on nov 7 at 39 weeks i am still hoping labor will start on their own
I'm hoping it starts on it's own also. I'm about to eat a load of pineapples walk and sex

question: I've been scheduled to get induced on my birthday in two weeks. I'm 38 weeks tomorrow and not dilated at all. I'm so nervous because I really want a natural birth.
title: induced
